fields.pet_bio: The name Sari means princess and that is what I want to be. I am a fairly independent girl so I can be your one and only to adore or I do get along well with calm and gentle cats. I am easy going and don't make many demands (except I do like some yummy treats).   During the day, I like to look out the window from a nice cat tree perch and I like to sleep on a comfy bed.  I am not a super lap cat but I enjoy being close to a human at the end of the day, snuggling in for the night.  Currently, I have not been around young children or dogs. My dob is March 1, 2011.

Yes, I am a cutie who loves to play and romp with other cats, but I am a very sweet girl also who enjoys holding and petting. My outgoing personality is one that will please everyone. My edob is 11/09.

I am a handsome, sweet boy who loves to romp  and play. I get along well with dogs, both big and small, and of course  enjoy the company of another cat. But I like to be petted too once I am  finished with my fun. I am more timid than my brother so am not found  of loud noises or sudden movements; probably a quieter home would be  good for me.  My edob is 9/11.

In the foster home, I am very sweet.   I  like the other cat and even the small dog, but when I get to adoption  day, I am a bit of a grump.   I prefer having a human to cuddle up with  and I really like to sleep on the bed.  I guess you could call me a  home body.   Now, what I need is the forever home that I so crave. My  edob is 3/12.

I'm  a sweet, lovey girl who just needs a safe home with the right people  and male dog companion. I want to follow you from room to room right at  your heels and sit as close as I can snuggle to your legs - your lap is  even better!  I also can't wait to go on very necessary walks with you  every day! My edob is 1/10.

I  am a super sweet dog who loves people and I thrive on attention and  affection. My personal favorite is a good belly rub!  I get along well  with children and other dogs.   I don't mess with cats but I am a tad  curious about them.   I don't have a high activity level but do enjoy  playtime.  My manners are very good as I am housetrained and crate  trained and do well on a leash for long walks.  My edob is 3/09.

I  love to play so give me a ball or something to chase and I am a happy  gal.  I get along great with other cats (I have littermates) and would  love to have a buddy.  Sometimes, a loud noise or quick movement makes  me a little shy so probably I would not be good with children but would  thrive in a quieter home. My edob is 5/12.

I  love to play so give me a ball or something to chase and I am a happy  guy.  I get along great with other cats (I have littermates) and would  love to have a buddy.  Sometimes, a loud noise or quick movement makes  me a little shy so probably I would not be good with children but would  thrive in a quieter home. My edob is 5/12.

I  am a sweet kitty with a high energy levelso would do well with another  play buddy and lots of toys like balls and catnip baggies. At first, I  am a tad shy but when I warm up, we can have lots of fun.  My edob is  4/12.

Being  an easy going guy, I get along with other cats and small dogs and enjoy  playing and hanging out.   I have a medium activity level and like  balls and stuffed toys.  Petting and being held are fine with me.  My  edob is 4/12.

Content, Quiet, Special Winnie is a mellow and happy girl. She likes to watch the world go by from her window perch (aka Cat TV), to chase the laser light, and to battle string toys. She plays with other cats but prefers privacy when she takes a nap. And if you have a vacant lap, she will take up residence in it and purr! Winnie was born with Manx Syndrome, a defect that causes her to be incontinent. This means she needs a compassionate owner who will help her express her urine a few times a day; this sounds harder than it actually is, and APA! will provide instruction on how to do it. Winnie doesn't have a tail, which is totally cute, but it is also helpful in keeping her clean - she is so accommodating! Winnie has beautiful green eyes and a sweet demeanor. She must always remain an indoor cat, but she does like to bask outside in a protected, enclosed area, such as a chicken coop or a rabbit hutch (without the chickens or rabbits, of course!). If you are looking to adopt a wonderful cat who also has special needs, we think you should meet Winnie. She will completely love you back. Contact us to meet her today! All APA! foster kittens/cats are tested for FeLV/FIV, spayed/neutered, vaccinated, treated for worms/fleas, microchipped and come with a 30-day health insurance plan. If you have additional questions about Winnie, please send an email to adopt@austinpetsalive.org.

We call him Chuck the Explorer. He has an odd and clumsy sort of gait, but that doesn't stop him from doing what he was born to do: sniffing. He's a natural investigative reporter, a newshound, a dashing detective. He makes even the occasional stumble look graceful and intentional, as if it is just part of his technique. Chuck likes to sniff out and thoroughly investigate any lead, scent, or visiting dog he encounters while on his walks. You are invited to come along. Every good reporter needs a trusty sidekick. After that walk, and perhaps some play (yes, Chuck does like to play, with his sidekick and with other dogs), Chuck is ready to settle in for some serious petting. He may be smart and independent, but he is also a sweet, affectionate kind of a guy. Chuck was adopted two years ago, but his family had to return him to APA! after they had to move overseas. They reported only positive notes - he is still the same sweet, adventurous and slightly clumsy dog he was when he was first with us. As much as he loves to explore, what Chuck really wants is a forever home. Exploring is no fun without a place to come back to.We think he'd do best in most homes, but he would especially love a yard and the occasional long and leisurely walk. He's a quick study, and had been working on some agility training when we saw him last. We're sure he'd love to get back into it. As happy as we are to see Chuck again, we'd be happiest to see him leave with the loyal, loving family he deserves. Can you join him on his biggest adventure yet?All APA adoptions come with free behavior assistance through APA's behavior team. And remember, when you adopt a dog from APA, you are saving not one, but two lives - the life of the dog you're bringing into your home, and the next dog APA can save in the adopted dog's place.

If Vickie had a theme song, it would most definitely be 'Eye of the Tiger.' She has been working hard to become the perfect companion, and has already come a long way in her training. She is whip-smart and eager for more challenges!This gorgeous girl was on the euthanasia list at the city shelter because she wasn't very interested in people. She just wanted to get out and explore the world. In just a few months since being rescued by APA!, though, she's become friendlier and friendlier, and will now happily rub up against your legs and ask for a nice belly rub after a rousing game of toy swapping.Vickie already knows the 'sit' command, and while it is not known if she is house trained, it is safe to say she'll learn quickly. She's a high energy dog and, with a little more leash training, will be a great running partner. Lifetime behavior training assistance is included with adoption. She prefers to watch her girlish figure, so she's not very treat motivated, but she absolutely loves toys and will flash a beautiful grin at you to melt your heart and convince you to pamper her with more. She needs to be the only pet in an adult-only home.Vickie is a stunning, blossoming sweet girl, and would love to be the one-and-only dog in your life. She will shine in a home where she can get some exercise and tons of attention.

Gracie is a special and playful girl who comes running for affection. She loves playing with soft  toys, and will toss them in the air in the hopes of grabbing your attention! An ideal home would  be an active one with cuddle breaks.   Gracie does have limited use of her back legs, but doesn't let that stop her from hopping up on  couches to be near you! She is not shy and loves to wobble around to explore her home. The  strength in her back legs is improving, but she will likely need to have her bladder expressed  twice a day for the foreseeable future. She is litter box trained and only has tiny accidents when  she is overly excited and has not gone recently.    All APA! foster kittens/cats are litter box-trained, tested for FeLV/FIV, spayed/neutered, vaccinated, treated for worms/fleas, microchipped and come with a 30-day health insurance plan. Sesame is a sweet black cat with big, beautiful eyes. Sesame loves to be pet and will purr when you stroke her. She is a shy girl who really just wants to be scratched behind her ears.   Sesame is looking for a loving home. She'd make a great companion for an older person or someone living alone! She would do best in a household where she can be the only kitty as she can be skittish with other cats. Come meet this sweet, shy girl -- will you be the one to give her the love she needs to come out of her shell?    All APA! foster kittens/cats are litter box-trained, tested for FeLV/FIV, spayed/neutered, vaccinated, treated for worms/fleas, microchipped and come with a 30-day health insurance plan. Diego is a bouncy, affectionate boy who likes tennis balls and frisbees almost as much as scratches and rubs. He's happy to fetch a tennis ball and will drop it on command and sit and wait until you throw it again. He will rub his body on you and crawl in your lap with a toy. He also loves butt scratches.Diego already knows the down, sit, come, and drop commands. He's great on a leash and has been working hard to ignore dogs when out for walks.This exuberant dog should be the only dog in a home without cats or children. A yard with a very sturdy fence would be ideal. He will benefit from long walks or runs and from a patient handler who will help Diego learn what it's like to live in a home.Come meet Diego and see if your home is in his future! All APA adoptions come with free behavior assistance through APA's behavior team.All APA adoptions come with free behavior assistance through APA's behavior team. And remember, when you adopt a dog from APA, you are saving not one, but two lives - the life of the dog you're bringing into your home, and the next dog APA can save in the adopted dog's place.(Check out an additional video of Diego here: http://youtu.be/5u3NAdSHF6Y)

How can you resist an all-white face, dotted with twinkling black eyes and ears that point straight up as if play is the only option? Meet Rusty Sledge. Even though Rusty Sledge is almost completely deaf, he is an amazingly smart guy who has been trained with hand signals for commands such as Sit, Down, Watch Me, Stay, and Stop. Get this: Rusty Sledge can even run on a treadmill. There's no telling how many more tricks this smarty can learn, especially considering how food motivated he is. Rusty Sledge is an energetic entertainer who will be a perfect running companion or just a bouncy playmate. Inside that muscular body, though, is a softie who will glance at you with his gentle eyes to see when you're ready for his company. Rusty Sledge is fully housetrained, although he still needs a little work to dial down his energy a notch or two. He needs to be the only pet in an adult home. He will thrive with owners who will give him plenty of exercise, interaction and playtime. Adoption includes free behavior support through APA.Rusty Sledge will be such a treat for some lucky family. Could that be yours?

Love is Unconditional.   Being different doesn't matter to her, being loved does. Caring for a special needs pet may take less time or money than you think... and the life you'll save is priceless.   O'Purry has a condition that is called Manx Syndrome. This means she was born without a tail and a shorter spine than most cats which has caused her to be fecally incontinent, and she also needs her bladder expressed a couple of times a day -- we know that sounds scary, but don't worry! Her foster and our vets will walk you through how to care for O'Purry and her special needs. O'Purry is easy to express and has no problems as long as you express her regularly (morning, lunch, after work and before bed). She will probably have to wear a diaper her entire life, but she doesn't let that stop her. She is a brave kitty, takes all of this all in stride, and still plays like a happy, confident kitten!   O'Purry, because of her shortened spine, also walks a bit differently than other cats. She gets around just fine, and is cute as a button! She moves more like a rabbit than a cat and can be heard hopping around from downstairs. She is able to climb up a cat tree but has to work hard to jump up on a chair. She loves to play with balls and mice and likes other cats. She will seek out your lap to sit and purr on.   Please email us to find out more about O'Purry an set up a meet and greet today!   All APA! foster kittens/cats are tested for FeLV/FIV, spayed/neutered, vaccinated, treated for worms/fleas, microchipped and come with a 30-day health insurance plan. If you have additional questions about the adoption process, please email  adopt@austinpetsalive.org.

SAVANNAH-ALABAMA WORLEY.  Must have fun with these names!  Savannah is a beautiful Rottweiler mix.  She is approximately 4 1/2 years of age and weighs 65 pounds.  Savannah is housetrained and crate trained and is okay on a leash.    She has "spurts" of energy and will play and run and then wants to lie down beside you and watch action movies.  Savannah is sweet and loving to all humans!  Like most people, Savannah likes some dogs and doesn't like others.  She would likely be happiest as the only pet so she can soak up all the love!For more information please email can.adoptions@yahoo.com OR can_rescue@yahoo.com.

Spence is more laid back and timid.  Either would make an excellent running partner.  The Twins are 4 1/2 years old, fully vetted and on heartworm preventative.  Spencer weighs 70 pounds and Tracy weighs 65 pounds.    The boys can be adopetd together, or separately.  FOR MORE INFORMATION ON ADOPTING SPENCER AND.OR TRACY, PLEASE EMAIL can.adoptions@yahoo.com OR can_rescue@yahoo.com.

Update 4/9/15.  Birdie has been with me about FIVE years waiting for the right home.  She is now about 7 years of age.  TALK ABOUT THE PERFECT DOG!  Birdie is amazing.  She is incredibly smart, obedient, sweet, and ATHLETIC.  Birdie was rescued from a backyard, where she had been for almost a month after her "owners" moved away.  She loves to play fetch , or just sit by you on the porch.  She would make an excellent jogging partner, and would be great at camping and hiking!  I've even seen other dogs try to intimidate her and she will just walk away.  Birdie is the ultimate companion.  She is extremely affectionate and naturally protective.  Birdie needs a person that will treat her as her family, take her everywhere, and spent time with her.  In all my years of rescuing dogs, Birdie stands out as one of the best examples of beauty, brains and great personality.THIS IS A FABULOUS DOG!!  Please email us for more information on adding Birdie to your family.  can.adoptions@yahoo.com or can_rescue@yahoo.com.

UPDATE 4/19/15.  This beautiful, loving girl is still searching for a permanent home.  We believe Diva is now about 7 years of age.  Diva's wish list is for a mature single female.  Someone who only wants love and devotion from their dog companion.  Diva has too many fears for a lot of walks and will be happiest and most secure just living with her guardian in her home with hopefully a lovely yard to sit in the sun and watch the squirrels and birds.  Diva's foster mom really loves Diva.  But she cannot give her the undivided attention and devotion the Diva craves.  Please email us for more information on Diva.Diva's is one of those heart-wrenching, soul crushing stories from which many turn away.  She was thrown out on a highway (seen by others) with her brother at perhaps 8-10 weeks of age.  Her brother was killed immediately and after she grieved, she found a culvert for shelter.  There she lived for months and survived by the kindness of a few who would stop to throw dry food out to her.  On the way back to Dallas from a home visit in Missouri, I stopped for gasoline at a small station in east Texas and saw her there.  I offered a reward to anyone who could catch her without harming her and shortly thereafter we had our Diva.  Diva got along so well with the other dogs and was so grateful for a never-ending bowl of food, fresh water and kindness.  She was always timid with people and we were very selective when searching for a home for her.  We thought we found the perfect match in a couple that professed commitment and love for her.  It took us several months to finalize the adoption because we wanted to be sure this was the right home.  Almost five years later Diva was returned to us -- almost unrecognizable (as you can see from the pictures), terribly overweight, and terrified.  We are blessed to have an extremely experienced, knowledgeable and caring trainer and close friend offer to foster Diva.  While progress has been made, we feel Diva needs to be posted as a Special Needs dog.  Below is what we feel will be the perfect home for this loving and sweet soul.DIVA must have either a FEMALE ONLY home or a couple where the man has infinite patience and dedication -- and as the only pet.  We can never know what really happened in her previous home.  She is leery of other dogs (but is fostered in a home with other dogs and gets along with them.)  While it is asking a lot,  I KNOW there is someone who wants unconditional love with a companion that asks almost nothing.  There IS a kind, patient, understanding and loving person that will appreciate and nurture this special girl.  Diva will never be a "dog park" dog.  She wants to feel safe and secure in her own home with a window to look outside.  Not too much to ask.  Diva loves tummy rubs and to lie beside you. PLEASE FORWARD DIVA'S INFORMATION SO THAT HER FOREVER HOME CAN BE FOUND.  If any dog deserved comfort and love, it is Diva.  Email Gail at can.adoptions@yahoo.com.

UPDATE 4/9/15:  Bruno is a VERY special dog and will need the right person to "complete" his life.  Bruno is in training classes at the Canine Center for Training and Behavior.  We believe Bruno would be happiest as an only dog with a single man who is looking for a forever companion.  Bruno seems to favor men and needs someone who is a "quiet alpha" who will provide the self confidence and commitment. Bruno's trainer has said Bruno is a "soft" dog and believes he has a lot of potential, as do I.  We would love to talk more with you about this wonderful boy.  Please email me at can.adoptions@yahoo.com.UPDATE 1/13/15:  WOW -- this dog is fantastic!  Very obedient and wants to please.  We have learned that Bruno had very little socialization in his life, and the other dogs in his original home jumped him from time to time.  We are working with him on meeting new dogs to show him that not every dog wants to start a fight.  He is in a large kennel with a senior dog and he has already settled down.  BRUNO LOVES TO RUN!!  He will make a fantastic running partner for someone.  And with his size should keep his guardian safe.  He is probably a little too big and active for smaller children.  He doesn't know his own strength and is dying to play with someone.  This boy is SWEET as they come and only needs someone committed to working with him.AWESOME DOG!!!  I am Bruno's foster mom.  I have only had him one day and am already in LOVE with this young man.  Bruno is about 2 years of age, 75 pounds, and a lump of love.  Through no fault of his own he has spent most of his life sitting in a backyard alone.  We are working on "manners" and he is VERY smart and obedient.  I envision a very active home for Bruno where he might be a running or jogging partner to some lucky person.  Bruno is already learning not to jump up (because he craves attention).  He went right into his kennel last night with no complaints!!  Bruno is going to be someone's best friend and confidant.

PRECIOUS SAMSON!!  Samson is a Black Mouth Cur, weighing 45 pounds.  He is a sweetheart and LOVES other dogs AND cats!  He is a little fearful of small children because of their noise and quick movements but would be fine with a little older children.  He is neutered, current on vaccinations, hw neg and on preventative.SAMSON IS IN AN URGENT SITUATION.  His owner is critically ill and can no longer care for him.  We desperately need a FOSTER or PERMANENT home for him as soon as possible.Samson was found abandoned in a backyard, tied to a tree.  Because of his being tethered for so long and then abandoned, he does have some separation anxiety.  Because of this, we are hoping to find someone who either works from home or could possibly take him with them to work as we have several dogs we have adopted to such circumstances.  PLEASE help us find a safe and appropriate place for this precious dog who has never done anything wrong!!  EMAIL US PLEASE.

I'm Lainey, a big cuddle bug with tons of love to give some lucky people.  I'm housetrained and know several commands already.  I'm very active, so I could be a great exercise partner! I love to play and rawhides are my favorite treat.  You should meet me soon so we can start having fun every day!  Be sure to ask for Lainey!

I'm Buck, a happy fellow with a big personality! I'm a friendly, outgoing, and assertive boy and love attention.  In return, I'm very affectionate.  I have trouble with my back legs, but that doesn't stop me!  The folks here have been great with top-notch medical attention and I'm ready for a loving, patient individual to choose me be their faithful companion.  Is it you?  Come to the Austin Humane Society today and ask for Buck!

Donald is my name and I'm a shiny black youngster waiting for my forever family to find me.  I'm a really interesting mix of breeds that make me loyal, smart, and adventuresome. At only 9 months old, I'm ready for someone to teach me the ropes.  I need help with my confidence from some loving people. In return, I'll mature into a great companion who could go running, hiking, or playing with you.  Let's get started right away!  Come to the Austin Humane Society and ask for Donald!

Sasha is my name, what's yours?  I'm a beautiful German Shepherd mix, just 5 months old, ready for my forever family to come and pick me up!  I'm still growing, so I'll probably be a large dog by the time it's all over with.  Playtime is my favorite time, so come meet me today and let's get this party started!  -- Sasha

Hi ya'll!  I'm Vada, a very friendly girl who LOVES people!  I'm very active and will play with you as long as you want.  "Fetch" is my favorite game and I'm very polite and respectful when I play.  Commands?  I know lots of them and I'm smart and could learn lots more!  Check out my video to see for yourself!  I'm housetrained and love to snuggle, too, despite my size.  You should come see me right away so we can get started on our life together!  Hurry over to the Austin Humane Society and ask for Vada!

Hi I'm Wrigley and I want to be your best friend! I have a lot of energy, so I'd be a great running partner! I love chasing after my toys, too, so maybe we can play fetch together? I'll need daily walks/runs to keep me healthy and happy! I'm young and ready to learn all kinds of new tricks and commands! I hope you'll let me be a part of your family!  Come over to the Austin Humane Society meet me today!  -- Wrigley

Babe's my name and flirting is my game. I'm a grownup sweetie-pie who likes everyone I meet. I'm an easy companion on walks and I love going out. Other dogs seem very interesting and friendly to me. Want to get acquainted with your new best friend?  Then hurry down today to the Austin Humane Society and ask for Babe!

I'm Tilly, a very attractive, very special girl waiting to meet you.  I'm sweet and patient with everyone, so I'd be good for most any type of family with kids of all ages.  When we play, I bet you don't even notice that I'm missing a back leg!  It doesn't slow me down a bit and I have lots of pep in my step!  If you want all the love and affection you can handle, then you just have to meet me!  C'mon down to the Austin Humane Society and ask for Tilly!

I'm Tessa, a happy girl with a lot to offer! I'm playful, friendly, and my tail is always wagging.  I'm a pretty big girl, but I'm very cuddly and affectionate.  I love to give kisses!  Housetrained?  Yep!  Crate-trained? You betcha!   I'm eager to please and happiest when I'm with my people. Hurry to see me at the Austin Humane Society right away!  -- Tessa

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.IN NEED OF A FOSTER HOME UNTIL I CAN BE ADOPTED!Hi my name is Jackson and I am a happy go lucky boy. Sometimes I look a little bored or a bit of a sour puss, but I am definately not! I'm a very personable guy who likes a lot of love and affection. I was previously in a home with two female dogs who I was happy to share my toys with and was very gentle with them. I am an easy natured boy who is happy being my crate. You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Hi, my name is Charlie. My owners literally threw me from a car when they found out I could not hear. Being deaf is scary enough without being tossed out of a car. I didn't understand why since I am a very loving boy who is eager to please. I just need someone who can work with my hearing loss. I am very smart and could easily learn hand signals. I love playing ball and with toys. I am a young handsome boxer mix with one brown eye and one blue eye. I am also a BIG snuggle bug, but since I have been living in a kennel for the past few years I have no one to snuggle with and I am very sad. I am understandably afraid of moving cars. I don't mind riding in them, but they scare me on walks. I would prefer a home of my own or one where I can trust the other dogs around won't hurt me or take my food. Since, I communicate with my eyes, some dogs find that as a threat or challenge. I am also not fond of smaller dogs or cats. I am hoping that my days of living (if you call that living) in a kennel will soon be over. At night I dream of a warm bed, soft pats on the head, and belly rubs. Are you that special person who could make my dreams come true? If so, please consider fostering or adopting me. Please contact LSBR for more information about me or to meet me! Hugs & Kisses.....Charlie July 20, 2015, 9:53 pm

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.What a difference a lot of love and some medical treatment makes! Just look at me now compared to a few weeks ago! Check out my pictures! Hi friends, my name is Riley and please don't let my horrible photos get you down or keep you from reading more about me. Thankfully, my story goes from awful to incredible. It is my hope that sharing my story will inspire others to treat animals better and make the world a better place. As you can see from the photos, I looked beyond pitiful when I came into rescue from the pound. I was severely emaciated and due to lack of food and poor nutrition, I lost all my hair and developed a horrible skin infection. Amazingly, I tested heartworm negative. Although I was painful to look at, good food, vitamins and medication are restoring me to what I'm supposed to be a beautiful, young pup with a joy for life. After a month in rescue, I've gained back my weight and my hair is slowly growing in. Skin takes the longest to heal according to my vet. I feel like a new dog compared to how I felt that day I was rescued. I had no hope and thought I was on my way out. What a happy day when the lady picked me up from the shelter, spoke to me kindly and carefully handled me knowing how painful my skin was. That is when I started to feel the hope. The vet thinks I'm under a year old and it looks I'll be a black dog with white markings when my hair returns. I'm also on the smaller side, weighing under 40 pounds. Until my hair returns and my skin fully heals, we can't begin to guess what my pedigree is. I am already house-trained and crate-trained. I am excellent with kids and other dogs. I love playing with toys of all kinds. I also know how to walk on leash and to sit. I'm very smart and I take care of my potty business when I'm told. Please help me write a beautiful, fairy tale ending to my rags to riches story by adopting me as a member of your family. When my hair returns, not only will you have a well-behaved, smart, loyal family member but also a really good-looking one with quite a story. Please contact Hopeful Hearts Animal Rescue at ann23hhar@gmail.com for an adoption application. July 20, 2015, 9:53 pm

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.They say Texas summers are brutal and they aren't fibbing. I found myself lost on the streets with no access to water or food in the Texas heat. Next thing you know, I couldn't go any further and just had to lie down in somebody's yard. I was suffering from heat exhaustion and dehydration. Word of advice, Drink lots of water in this heat friends. The great news is that an angel rescued me from that yard and took me to the vet where I quickly perked up after receiving some water and food. Angels are for real!!! My angel, Kayla, is trying to help me find a wonderful family to call my own. She has named me Noelle which is a lovely name. I am a female boxer mix that is between 1-2 years of age. I am heartworm negative and I love to play with other dogs and people. I am off the charts in sweetness and cuteness. I am also crate and house-trained. I am anxious to find a home where I will be safe and loved. This isn't a one way street with me. I give back and what I have to offer is loyalty, love, kisses, and lots of smiles!!! Please consider opening your heart and home to a wonderful dog like me. You may contact my angel, Kayla at 713- 703-1528 or email her at kbcrenshaw@comcast.net. July 20, 2015, 9:53 pm

My name is Zeus. I am a beautiful male American Eskimo...sometimes people just call us "Spitz" or more lovingly, "Eskie".  I am about 2 years old and a perfect "10".  ;)  My rescuer does ask that you fill out an application before meeting me...and there is a donation request of at least $250.00 to adopt me.    I used to be in a not so nice place, they called it "the animal control" but I am not sure why because they never controlled me!  I was in my best behavior though as I was afraid. Then some very nice people got me out of there , cleaned me up and made me feel better . I am now in a foster home and have LOTS of foster brothers and sisters to play with.    I stand up on my back legs and wave at you , Dad says I look like a HUGE Meercat . Especially if you have treats ! I have a very special job here . I am a home alarm system . I let Dad and Mom know when someone comes to the steps . I also smile ( kinda ) . I'm just one happy guy...and I LOVE my leash. All I ask is a secure fenced in back yard. A pillow or two . I'm smart , very smart . I am a bit curious about cats, they look strange and I just don't know what to make of them.     If you would like to adopt me, please fill out the New Leash on Life! American Eskimo Dog Rescue Application on their website " www.nlol.net" , email newleashonlife@att.net or call Carol Raymond at 210-410-7334

fields.pet_shelter_name: San Francisco Animal Care and Control
fields.pet_bio: King Pigeons make great pets and companion birds. They are sweet, smart, calm, and full of personality. But people are not very aware of them as being pets and they have a hard time finding a home. Kings are domestic pigeons that are bred to be eaten, but they sometimes escape or are set "free". They do not survive long on their own. The lucky ones, like Pat and Snowberry, end up in shelters, though they often wait for a long time before finding a home. Come in and see Pat and Snowberry and the other King Pigeons at the shelter and see if these are the companions you have been waiting for and just did not know it yet. Contact Palomacy Pigeon & Dove Adoptions see http://www.pigeonrescue.org/ for more information

Pickles is likely a lab-chi-terrier-dachshund mix, 5 year old, neutered male dog in good health with all shots who weighs between 16-18 pounds. His short, neat coat is golden. He is short-legged and long-bodied has stand-up ears, a ready-to-wag tail with a slight curve, and big brown eyes in an intelligent, expressive, foxy face. He is really cute.Pickles is an extremely affectionate & loving little dog with the people he loves. We believe that he is a recovering victim of abuse, so he is afraid of strangers, so all introductions must be done very carefully and patiently. He loves to cuddle, kiss and play. He is a smart little dog who learns quickly. It takes a few days for Pickles to fall in love with people, but thereafter he is super-sweet. Pickles really needs a special gentle kind affectionate person or people to love and take care of him. Because of his fear issues, he should be in an adult only household. Pickles has a medium energy level, and only needs moderate exercise. He walks very well on leash. Pickles loves to play with his toys and especially play ball. Pickles gets along very well with other dogs & likes dogs both inside and out of his pack. He prefers to sleep with his person, but can sleep elsewhere, including a crate. He is a natural watch dog, but only barks for a good reason. With some gentle love, care & training, Pickles will make a fine house or apartment dog.Please email adopt@rocketdogrescue.org or TEXT at 415-756-8188 with 'PICKLES' in the subject line for more info.Thanks you for considering adoption!Adopting a rescued animal is a lifetime commitment! Adopters must complete a questionnaire, personal interview and home visit prior to adopting a Rocket Dog. There is a non-refundable $240.00 adoption fee which helps us defer the cost of spay/neutering, vaccinations and microchipping, food and medication (Rocket Dog Rescue is a 501(c)(3)nonprofit organization and this fee enables us to continue rescuing and helping animals). capone is a 1 1/2 -2 year old pitbull who came to rocket dog rescue from oakland animal services where he ran out of time. capone was taken out of an oakland dog fighting home in december. capone will fit in a home where there is grass(he loves to lay on it) no small dogs and would rather go to a home with no cats, a home with time for lots of excersise and play time. he LOVES tennis balls and nylabones.capone is a love bug so he is completly content just sitting on the couch with you by his side petting him. he loves his 3foot teddy bear too. wich will of course come with the adoption.along with some other toys and his nylabone, bowls and kong toy capone was not a dog that was ever inside a home or car, just chained up in the back yard with no shade water or food. he wighed around thirty six pounds when brought to my home as a foster baby and now wieghs 50lbs.when capone was brought to my home he didnt know how to play with toys, he wasnt potty trained, he did not know basic commands for exs: sit, stay, come, things of that sort. mind you i got him january 28th so it has not even been a month yet. capone now knows sit stay shake, kennel trained and is potty trained. he learned alot in less than a month.he is also trained with the squirt bottle so knows that also.he is eager to please and does not have one mean bone in his body. i have a pitbull mix as mypersonal dog and they are bestfriends now. love to run in the backyard and play tug of war with one another. he is neutered and up to date on his shots.i fell inlove with this dog and if you give him a chance you will fall inlove with him too.if you want to be his loving new fur-mom or fur-dad fill out an adoption form at www.rocketdogrescue.orgAdopting a rescued animal is a lifetime commitment! Adopters must complete a agreement (http://www.rocketdogrescue.org/adopt/adoption-application/), personal interview and home visit prior to adopting a Rocket Dog. There is a non-refundable $240.00 adoption fee which helps us defer the cost of spay/neutering, vaccinations and microchipping, food and medication (Rocket Dog Rescue is a 501(c)(3)nonprofit organization and this fee enables us to continue rescuing and helping animals).

Handsome Hobie (aka, Hobster) is a fawn Boxer/Pit Bull mix available for adoption through Rocket Dog Rescue. He is about two years old and currently weighs 50 pounds. Hobie is a bright dog who has mastered his basic commands like sit, stay, heal, come, and more! With treats and food, he will learn almost anything! Hobie is also perfectly crate-trained and house-trained.He is currently being fostered with other dogs and is working on his manners. He loves his daily walks and would make an excellent jogging or hiking partner (he is great on a leash!). Hobie would thrive with an experienced owner willing to provide him the love, care, and structure that he needs.Hobster is now neutered, up-to-date on all vaccines, and microchipped. If you are interested in providing Hobster with a loving home, please email adopt@rocketdogrescue.org.More photos of Handsome Hobster: http://www.marianamaya.com/2013/03/meet-handsome-hobster-aka-hobo-rocket-dog-rescue-bay-area-pet-photography/See Hobo's rescue here: http://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.441858485885106.1073741825.149417048462586&type=3Please email adopt@rocketdogrescue.org to meet him!Adopting a rescued animal is a lifetime commitment! Hallie is a big strong girl who loves to play with her chew toys, pull toys, and bones  and to have you play with her (you won't win at tug of war, unless you tempt her with peanut butter). She can be very content sitting in her perch looking out the window, but she is always ready to go out with you. She's crate-trained, spayed, chipped and licensed (SF). She shows signs of being a world-class swimmer and athlete (her ability to catch pop flies is astounding). Hallie is nearly 2 years old (born in March 2012) and needs a LOT of exercise, every day. She is 60 lbs of muscle and curiosity! Once sufficiently tired out, she loves relaxing with a squeak toy or curling up near you to snooze. She is a lovely girl who is extremely wiggly and adores people!Those looking to adopt Hallie must be experienced pit handlers or exp with large strong breeds, preferably with their own outdoor or yard space. She should be the only dog in the home and is not good with cats. Older children may be OK with an experienced owner.Hallie will come with her crate, bones, training gear, heartworm meds and 3 training lessons with her trainer.Hallie is looking for her new home as her mom is a single city dweller with a full-time out of home job who can't offer her enough exercise time or a consistently good place to burn it off. Hallie needs to be with a couple or family who can devote a lot of time to training, exercising and loving her.View more pics of Hallie here: https://www.dropbox.com/sc/yh509giobv5g0wd/AABNNuOdofPlease email adopt@rocketdogrescue.org to meet Hallie!Adopting a rescued animal is a lifetime commitment! This is beautiful Brooklyn! Brooklyn is amazing dog, with lots of happy energy and she is going to make someone very, very happy. She's a good girl who has so much potential and is so devoted to her people. She had such a rough beginning in life and so deserves a second chance ... Could that be with you?email adopt@rocketdogrescue.org to set up a time to meet this pretty girl heart emoticon(SF Bay Area only)She was saved from the shelter on her last day and has been so thankful ever since She is much like a puppy, very loving, adores people. She's a beautiful girl too and gets compliments everywhere she goes!  She is crate trained and is fine when left alone.Brooklyn has done intensive  in house training program where she learned all her commands!She is good with dogs she gets to know, and is fine as long as dogs don't show aggression towards her.Adopting a rescued animal is a lifetime commitment! Meet Red aka Mc Lovin'  He's a 2 year old male pitty who came to us from the Sacramento shelter, after his owner was hospitalized. He weights 56lbs.The shelter volunteers loved him, and Red greets everyone  by sitting in her lap. :-) Red LOVES cuddles and rolled onto his backwith her and snuggled under her arm with a the biggest grin on his face. Red would definitely like to be a lap dog!  Red also visited with us in our office, where he flopped onto his back into my lap like a loosey goosey ragdoll. Angela found she could hug him, pull on his legs andspin him around on his back (!) and put an antler headband on him  and sweet Red took it all in stride, happy for the attention!Big red is a wonderful boy, and a goof ball who is going to make someone very happy! He is doing well in his foster home. He is house trained and knows all basic commands:he's the star pupil at Bob Gutierrez training classes, easy to train and eager to pleaseis totally housebrokenhugs on command!extremely affectionate and attached to people, should be with someone who will train, play and exercise with him (he's a great jogging partner)great with kids and all people, but I wouldn't recommend a house with small children (just because he's a big clunker head and might knock them over) and definitely no catscould be fine with another dog in the house but would need to be introduced carefullyHe comes with free lifetime dog sitting (at our house) and we'll work with the adopters to show them all his training, tricks etc (if they want).food and medication (Rocket Dog Rescue is a 501(c)(3)nonprofit organization and this fee enables us to continue rescuing and helping animals).rocketdogrescue.orgAdopting a rescued animal is a lifetime commitment! Coleman Brown is a remarkable creature in every way. This 15 mo. Pit Bull/Beagle is even more adorable in person than in pictures. He's a true snuggle bun just try to resist when all 60 lbs of his velvety self climbs into your lap and lays his big head on your chestBut don't let his softer side deceive you; Coleman loves to turn the dial up to 11. He exhibits typical bully breed behaviors; he's an athletic, rough n tumble player and a real rascal around the house.He also exhibits common beagle traitshe's easily distracted with strong hunting instincts, requiring full attention when he's on leash and prohibiting off leash adventures. Coleman's crate trained and house broken (as long as he has access outdoors).Shortly after the photo on the counter, he spent a month at a board and train program, where he made progress paying attention and following commands (sit, down, stand, stay, heel, come, wait), but respect-based training will always be a daily requirement since he takes a yard for every inch. He loves to play hard and cuddle soft with his female foster mate but is not socialized around cats, or small dogs. He will do great in an adult home. Coleman needs an experienced handler who enjoys a strict training regimen and who has the time and commitment for a dog who loves to push the boundaries. That said, in a firm and loving home, Coleman will be a truly rewarding companion. His adoption will come with free training sessions for the right home.rocketdogrescue.orgAdopting a rescued animal is a lifetime commitment! Handsome Hank is a mix up all all the coolest dogs. Possibly some hound, lab, shepherd. We just dont know, he is a true beauty of mixed heritage ; )This (really) good boy is estimated to be  6-7 years old but seems younger to me.  he is cool, cooperative, helpful, he likes to be your right hand man, your buddy, your side-kickHandsome Hank needs an experience home- He can be nervous with new dogs- and people. He will need continued socialization. He needs an adult home. Meet Frankie (aka Skeeter)Frankie is local chi-weenie looking' boy that came to us from SF ACC. He's about 3 years old, weighs a solid 10 lbs and still acts very much like a puppy (curious about everything) He does great in his crate and sleeps through the night without any noise, he is house trained and never has accidents in the house! Frankie, in true weiner dog style, is a chatty guy (NOT a barker), he is affectionate, charming and loves to cuddle. He LOVES the beach, rides well in the car and he LOVES his toys  he is very silly.  Frankie is attentive to corrections, knows basic commands and with continued love, and consistent household rules this boy will continue to be a wonderful loving companion. Frankie is a beautiful boy, with a white heart marking on his forehead, a sweet pink nose  and his Opossum cartoon-like looks and charm. I think he would like to live with another dog (or two) so he has company while his people are away (he really enjoys the company of his foster brothers and sister). we recommend he be placed in an adult home or one with older (10+) respectful dog savvy children.  Frankie is friendly with new people and new dogs, but is much more likely to make friends with women strangers than men strangers. http://www.rocketdogrescue.org/dog/frankie/?status=for-adoptionAdopting a rescued animal is a lifetime commitment! Meet Loki! He is a sweet cool little guy that weighs about 25 pounds  Loki is aprox 7-8 years old we are guessing.. don't let his age full you- hes still full of energy and would be an amazing hiking buddy! he has a funny sweet personality and shines with a  joyfulness that will fill your life with sunshine :)  He's a spunky, cute and very happy little fella. Loki should be the only dog in the household. Sookie is an adorable 4 year old kitty who loves loves loves affection and cuddles. She's not all taker tho... she does half the work by standing on her back legs and reaching up to meet your hand when you go to pet her. She also loves to give "kisses."  If you are looking for a friendly people-loving cat look no further!Sookie must be adopted into a home that already has a cat. She will make a wonderful companion to your kitty. She is currently fostered with a young male kitty and does well with him. She has also lived with children in the past and gets along with everyone. Please fill out the adoption application on our website if you are interested in meeting her. Wonder Cat Rescue is not a shelter, but a team of caring foster homes and volunteers who open our own homes to needy cats until permanent placement can be found. By adopting a cat from Wonder Cat Rescue, you're making a commitment to provide love, care, and medical treatment for the life of the cat, which can be up to 20 years or more.  Adopting a cat is a serious decision, but a very rewarding one! We make every effort to make the best possible match when placing our cats/kittens with new families. Once you submit an application you will be contacted if the particular cat/kitten you are interested in is a good match for you. Many times kittens have several interested parties and you will be contacted if/when a meeting is appropriate. Each adoptive homes is screened carefully, and a lot of support is given to make sure the adoption is a success. When cats have a 'pending' banner, it means we are no longer accepting applications, and he/she will be placed in their forever home soon. Sorry we do not ship under any circumstances. The required adoption donation is $125.00. This includes the following veterinary services unless otherwise stated in the adoption contract: vet exam, spay/neuter, FeLV/FIV testing, indoor-cat vaccinations, flea treatment, anti-parasite medications and microchip. The value of the care averages $400.00 per healthy animal, and does not include food and other direct care supplies. A large portion of our animals also receive medical services above and beyond this amount.To adopt a cat, please complete an Adoption Application:  Click here!

Callie is young kitty who has raised her first (and only) batch of kittens. They are 10 week old now and we estimate her to be a year and a half. They are all ready to go on to their forever homes. She is very delicate. He body shape is very Siamese-like. She is slim and long with a regal profile. She's been a devoted Mama but is now starting to play and romp around with her little buds instead of always protectively being on Mama-alert for a cry or too much rough-housing. She's ready to go back to being a young kitty herself.She is very gentle with people. Loves soft head and face rubs. Meet Baby Girl. This is one of my most favorite rescue dogs of all time. She is the momma dog to some puppies that have passed through our rescue system over the years. She is finally mine to rescue out and I couldn't be happier! Baby Girl is shy at first, but makes friends easily. She would do best as a only dog or with another quiet dog. She is housetrained and great on a leash. Baby Girl is up to date on shots, spayed and microchipped. Unfortunately, Baby Girl is heart worm positive. Her adoption fee covers the cost of her treatment. Given her special situation, Baby Girl is available for immediate foster. She is great with kids and weighs about 36 pounds.  If interested, please fill out the online app at www.zeusrescues.org or email zeusrescues@gmail.com for more info.

fields.pet_breed: Domestic Short Hair - orange and white
fields.pet_bio: Meet Caroline. Caroline is great with other cats, but prefers not to be around dogs. She has a bit of a catnip problem, but since it is not legal all 50 states, we are not sending her to any support groups. Caroline is up to date on shots, combo tested negative, spayed and microchipped. If interested, please fill out the online app at www.zeusrescues.org or email zeusrescues@gmail.com.

Meet Fluffer Nutter. If you like the look of a beautiful cat, but don't want it to nag you for love, Fluffer is for you. She is not mean, she just feels that the human touch is like acid that will melt her skin. Fluffer loves the company of other cats. She will never bite, only look at you with the disdain, as only a cat can. Fluffer is up to date on shots, combo tested negative, spayed and microchipped. If interested, please fill out the online app at www.zeusrescues.org or email zeusrescues@gmail.com.

Meet Berlin. This year old shephard mix loves to play with other dogs and is great humans. She can jump short fences in a single leap. She would be great in agility training. Berlin weighs 60 pounds, is up to date on shots, spayed, heart worm negative, microchipped and house/crate trained. Email Zeusrescues@gmail.com for more info or fill out the online app at www.zeusrescues.org.  at Zeus' Place.

Meet Duke. This sweet 4 year old lab mix was surrendered by his owner, who moved to a small apartment and couldn't keep him. He's in a foster home now, but is looking for this forever home. He loves going for rides in the car and walks in the park. He also loves playing fetch, chewing on squeaky toys, and "helping" you do whatever you're doing right now. He is up to date on shots, heartworm negative, neutered, and crate trained. His foster home has small children and he has been very sweet with them. He has trouble remembering which food bowl is his, though, so he might be best with a passive dog or even as an only dog. He hasn't been tested with cats.

Meet Blue Ivy. This 3 year old blue pit bull arrived at ZP VERY pregnant. She gave birth to 11 puppies shortly after her arrival. She raised them all and they have found great homes. It is Blue Ivy's turn to find a good home. Blue Ivy survived on the streets for quite some time, so she would prefer to be the only dog in your house. She is great with humans of all sizes and ages. Blue Ivy is up to date on shots, heart worm negative, micro chipped and house trained. If interested, fill out the online app at www.zeusrescues.org or email zeusrescues@gmail.com for more info.

Meet Sunny. What a difference a little love makes in the life of a pet. Sunny was discarded at the JPAS shelter. When she first arrived, she growled at everyone. She also had awful teeth, her fur was almost all the way gone and her nail had grown so long that they curled back under and were growing in tot he pads of her feet making it painful to stand or walk. With the help of an amazing foster home (and a surgery to spay her and remove some rotten teeth), Sunny is finally ready for her new home. She is great with humans, but selective of her canine friends. She prefers calm dogs to 'in your face' or rambunctious pups. Sunny is about 4 years old, up to date on shots, spayed, housetrained and microchipped. If interested, fill out the online app at www.zeusrescues.org or. email zeusrescues@gmail.com.
